intro: Erycibe leucoxyloides, commonly known as the white-wood hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
